/ noun, symbol, abbr.

pl. As, A’s, a’s /
eɪz
/
)
1 [
C ,
U
] the first letter of the English alphabet  chữ A (con chữ thứ nhất trong bảng chữ cái tiếng Anh):
‘Apple’ begins with (an) A/‘A’.
2 A [
C ,
U
] ( music nhạc
) the 6th note in the scale of C major  nốt La
3 [
C ,
U
] the highest mark/grade that a student can get for a piece of work or course of study điểm/hạng xếp thứ nhất mà học sinh, sinh viên đạt được của một bài làm/một khoá học:
She got (an) A in/for Biology. ◇ He had straight A’s (= nothing but A’s) all through high school.
4 A [
U
] used to represent the first of two or more possibilities dùng để chỉ lựa chọn thứ nhất trong hai hay nhiều khả năng lựa chọn:
Shall we go for plan A or plan B?
5 A [
U
] used to represent a person, for example in an imagined situation or to hide their identity dùng để chỉ một người, chẳng hạn trong một tình huống tưởng tượng hoặc để giấu gốc gác của người đó:
Assume A knows B is guilty.
asee also
A-frame ,
A level ,
A-road
i
from A to B from one place to another  từ nơi này đến nơi khác:
For me a car is just a means of getting from A to B.
from A to Z including everything there is to know about sth  từ đầu đến cuối, từ A đến Z:
He knew his subject from A to Z.
_S symbol
1 used in Britain before a number to refer to a particular important road (ở Anh) dùng trước một con số để chỉ một con đường quan trọng:
the A34 to Newbury
2 used (but not in the US) before numbers which show standard metric sizes of paper được dùng trước các con số để chỉ các cỡ giấy chuẩn hệ mét (nhưng không được dùng ở Mỹ):
a sheet of A4 paper (= 297×210mm) ◇ A3 (= 420×297mm) ◇ A5 (= 210×148mm)
_S abbr. (in writing văn viết
)
amp(s)
a
a k /
ə; strong form eɪ
/
( also an /
ən; strong form æn
/)
indefinite article
h
A được dùng trước các âm phụ âm và an được dùng trước các âm nguyên âm. Khi nói những từ tắt như ‘FM’ hay ‘UN’, dùng a hay an là tùy theo cách phát âm chữ cái đầu tiên. Ví dụ, F là một phụ âm, nhưng bắt đầu bằng âm /e/ nên phải nói: an FM radio. U là một nguyên âm nhưng bắt đầu bằng âm /j/ nên phải nói: a UN declaration.
1 k used before countable or singular nouns referring to people or things that have not already been mentioned dùng trước danh từ đếm được hay danh từ số ít để nói về người/vật chưa được nhắc đến:
a man/horse/unit ◇ an aunt/egg/hour/x-ray ◇ I can only carry two at a time. ◇ There’s a visitor for you. ◇ She’s a friend of my father’s (= one of my father’s friends).
2 k used before uncountable nouns when these have an adjective in front of them, or phrase following them dùng trước danh từ không đếm được khi có tính từ đứng trước, hay cụm từ theo sau:
a good knowledge of French ◇ a sadness that won’t go away
3 k any; every  một (thứ bất kỳ); mọi (thứ trong cùng một loại):
A lion is a dangerous animal.
4 k used to show that sb/sth is a member of a group or profession dùng để chỉ người nào/vật gì là thành viên của một nhóm hay một ngành nghề:
Their new car’s a BMW. ◇ She’s a Buddhist. ◇ He’s a teacher. ◇ Is that a Monet (= a painting by Monet)?
5 used in front of two nouns that are seen as a single unit dùng trước hai danh từ được xem như một đơn vị:
a knife and fork
6 used instead of one before some numbers dùng thay cho one (một) trước một vài từ chỉ con số:
A thousand people were there.
7 used when talking about prices, quantities and rates dùng khi nói về giá cả, số lượng, tốc độ và tỷ lệ
s
per
: They cost 50p a kilo. ◇ I can type 50 words a minute. ◇ He was driving at 50 miles an hour.
8 a person like sb người giống với một người khác:
She’s a little Hitler.
9 used before sb’s name to show that the speaker does not know the person dùng trước tên người để chứng tỏ rằng người nói không biết người ấy:
There’s a Mrs Green to see you.
10 used before the names of days of the week to talk about one particular day dùng trước tên ngày trong tuần để nói đến một ngày cụ thể:
She died on a Tuesday.
a- a- /
eɪ
/ prefix (in nouns, adjectives and adverbs tiền tố trong danh từ, tính từ và trạng từ
) not; without  không; không có; vô, bất, phi:
atheist ◇ atypical ◇ asexually
A1 A1 /
ˌeɪ ˈwʌn
/ adj. ( informal) very good  rất tốt:
The car was in A1 condition.
A2 (level) A2 (level) /
ˌeɪ ˈtuː levl
/ noun [
C ,
U
] a British exam usually taken in Year 13 of school or college (= the final year) when students are aged 18. Students must first have studied a subject at AS level before they can take an A2 exam. Together AS and A2 level exams form the A-level qualification, which is needed for entrance to universities kỳ thi ở Anh thường được tổ chức cho học sinh khi được 18 tuổi vào năm học thứ 13 (năm học cuối bậc phổ thông). Trước tiên, học sinh phải học qua một môn ở bậc AS rồi mới được tham dự kỳ thi A2. Cả hai kỳ thi bậc AS và A2 giúp học sinh có được chứng chỉ bậc A cần thiết để được vào đại học:
A2 exams ◇ Students will normally take three A2 subjects. ◇ He’s doing an A2 (level) in History. ◇ More than 20 subjects are on offer at A2 level at our college.

/

_S verb
1 k to leave sb, especially sb you are responsible for, with no intention of returning  bỏ rơi, bỏ mặc:
~ sb The baby had been abandoned by its mother. ◇ ~ sb to sth The study showed a deep fear among the elderly of being abandoned to the care of strangers.
2 k to leave a thing or place, especially because it is impossible or dangerous to stay  rời khỏi
s
leave
: ~ sth Snow forced many drivers to abandon their vehicles. ◇ He gave the order to abandon ship (= to leave the ship because it was sinking). ◇ ~ sth to sb/sth They had to abandon their lands to the invading forces.
3 k ~ sth to stop doing sth, especially before it is finished; to stop having sth  ngừng việc đang làm, nhất là bỏ giữa chừng; từ bỏ thứ gì:
They abandoned the match because of rain. ◇ She abandoned hope of any reconciliation.
4 to stop supporting or helping sb; to stop believing in sth ngừng ủng hộ hoặc giúp đỡ ai; không còn tin vào điều gì:
~ sb The country abandoned its political leaders after the war. ◇ ~ sth By 1930 he had abandoned his Marxist principles.
5 ~ yourself to sth ( literary) to feel an emotion so strongly that you can feel nothing else xúc động mạnh đến nỗi không còn cảm nhận được điều gì khác:
He abandoned himself to despair.
_S noun [
U
] ( formal) an uncontrolled way of behaving that shows that sb does not care what other people think  sự buông thả; sự phóng túng:
He signed cheques with careless abandon.

absolute k /
ˈæbsəluːt
/ adj., noun
_S adj.
1 k total and complete tuyệt đối :

2 k [
only before noun
] used, especially in spoken English, to give emphasis to what you are saying dùng để nhấn mạnh điều đang nói, nhất là trong văn nói tiếng Anh:
There’s absolute rubbish on television tonight. ◇ He must earn an absolute fortune.
3 definite and without any doubt or confusion rõ ràng, được xác định và không có sự nghi ngờ hay nhầm lẫn nào; chắc chắn :
There was no absolute proof. ◇ He taught us that the laws of physics were absolute. ◇ The divorce became absolute last week.
asee also decree absolute
4 not limited or restricted không hạn chế, không giới hạn :
absolute power/authority ◇ an absolute ruler/monarchy (= one with no limit to their power)
5 existing or measured independently and not in relation to sth else độc lập :
Although prices are falling in absolute terms, energy is still expensive. ◇ Beauty cannot be measured by any absolute standard.
acompare relative
_S noun an idea or a principle that is believed to be true or valid in any circumstances cái tuyệt đối :
Right and wrong are, for her, moral absolutes.

ˈæbsəluːtli
/ adv.
1 k used to emphasize that sth is completely true  tuyệt đối :
You’re absolutely right. ◇ He made it absolutely clear.
2 k absolutely no…, absolutely nothing used to emphasize sth negative  tuyệt đối không, hoàn toàn không :

3 k used with adjectives or verbs that express strong feelings or extreme qualities to mean ‘extremely’ dùng với tính từ hay động từ để bổ sung nghĩa ‘tuyệt đối’; hoàn toàn, hết sức; rất, cực kỳ :
I was absolutely furious with him. ◇ She absolutely adores you. ◇ He’s an absolutely brilliant cook.
4 k /
ˌæbsəˈluːtli
/ used to emphasize that you agree with sb, or to give sb permission to do sth dùng để nhấn mạnh rằng bạn đồng ý với ai, hay cho phép ai làm gì; tất nhiên rồi/được chứ!, vv. :
‘They could have told us, couldn’t they?’ ‘Absolutely!’ ◇ ‘Can we leave a little early?’ ‘Absolutely!’
5 k absolutely not used to emphasize that you strongly disagree with sb, or to refuse permission dùng để nhấn mạnh rằng bạn hoàn toàn không đồng ý với ai, hay không cho phép; dứt khoát không :
‘Was it any good?’ ‘No, absolutely not.’

across
across k /
əˈkrɒs; NAmE əˈkrɔːs; əˈkrɑːs
/ adv., prep.
_S adv.
h
Xem các cách sử dụng đặc biệt của từ across trong cụm động từ tại mục từ của các động từ này. Ví dụ, come across ở mục cụm động từ của từ come.
1 k from one side to the other side từ bên này sang bên kia; (ngang) qua :
It’s too wide. We can’t swim across. ◇ The yard measures about 50 feet across.
2 k in a particular direction towards or at sb/sth về phía (ai/cái gì):
When my name was called, he looked across at me.
3 k across from opposite đối diện :
There’s a school just across from our house.
4 ( of an answer in a crossword về câu trả lời trong trò chơi ô chữ
) written from side to side  viết ngang (từ bên này sang bên kia):
I can’t do 3 across.
_S prep.
1 k from one side to the other side of sth từ bên này sang bên kia của cái gì; băng ngang :
He walked across the field. ◇ I drew a line across the page. ◇ A grin spread across her face. ◇ Where’s the nearest bridge across the river?
2 k on the other side of sth ở phía bên kia :
There’s a bank right across the street.
3 on or over a part of the body ở trên một phần cơ thể:
He hit him across the face. ◇ It’s too tight across the back.
4 in every part of a place, group of people, etc. khắp
s
throughout
: Her family is scattered across the country. ◇ This view is common across all sections of the community.

ˈact for/on behalf of sb to be employed to deal with sb’s affairs for them, for example by representing them in court đại diện/thay mặt cho ai

ˌact sth↔ˈout
1 to perform a ceremony or show how sth happened, as if performing a play  thực hiện một nghi lễ/diễn lại một việc đã xảy ra như đang diễn kịch:

2 to act a part in a real situation đóng vai trong một tình huống thật:

ˌact ˈup ( informal)

2 to not work as it should không hoạt động bình thường; có sự cố, trục trặc:

ˈæktʃuəl
/ adj. [
only before noun
]
1 k used to emphasize sth that is real or exists in fact  dùng để nhấn mạnh điều có thật hay có tồn tại trong thực tế; thật sự:
What were his actual words? ◇ The actual cost was higher than we expected. ◇ James looks younger than his wife but in actual fact (= really) he is five years older.
2 k used to emphasize the most important part of sth  dùng để nhấn mạnh phần quan trọng nhất; thật sự:
The wedding preparations take weeks but the actual ceremony takes less than an hour.

usually pl.

ac•tu•al•ize actualize (BrE also
-ise) /
ˈæktʃuəlaɪz
/ verb
~ sth to make sth real; to make sth happen biến thành hiện thực; thực hiện :

ac•tu•al•ly
actually k /
ˈæktʃuəli
/ adv.
1 k used in speaking to emphasize a fact or a comment, or that sth is really true 
thực sự, trên thực tế, thật ra (dùng trong văn nói để nhấn mạnh tính xác thực của một sự việc, một lời nhận xét hay một điều gì đó):
What did she actually say? ◇ It’s not actually raining now. ◇ That’s the only reason I’m actually going. ◇ There are lots of people there who can actually help you. ◇ I didn’t want to say anything without actually reading the letter first.
2 k used to show a contrast between what is true and what sb believes, and to show surprise about this contrast 
thật ra (dùng để diễn tả sự tương phản giữa điều có thật và điều người nào tin, và thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên về sự tương phản này):
It was actually quite fun after all. ◇ The food was not actually all that expensive. ◇ Our turnover actually increased last year.
3 k used to correct sb in a polite way  dùng để đính chính cho ai một cách lịch sự; đúng ra, thật ra:
We’re not American, actually. We’re Canadian. ◇ Actually, it would be much more sensible to do it later. ◇ They’re not married, actually.
4 k used to get sb’s attention, to introduce a new topic or to say sth that sb may not like, in a polite way  dùng để thu hút sự chú ý, để đưa ra một chủ đề mới hay để lịch sự nói ra điều mà người khác có thể không thích; thật ra, quả thật:
Actually, I’ll be a bit late home. ◇ Actually, I’m busy at the moment—can I call you back?

ˈadded to this… | ˈadd to this… used to introduce another fact that helps to emphasize a point you have already made  dùng để đưa thêm một sự kiện để nhấn mạnh cho quan điểm vừa được đưa ra; thêm vào đó:

ˌadd ˈup ( informal)
1 (especially in negative sentences  nhất là trong câu phủ định ) to seem reasonable; to make sense  có vẻ có lý; có ý nghĩa:

2 (not used in the progressive tenses  không dùng với thì tiếp diễn ) to increase by small amounts until there is a large total 
tăng dần (cho đến khi tổng thể trở nên lớn):

ˌadd ˈup | ˌadd sth↔ˈup k to calculate the total of two or more numbers or amounts  tính tổng của hai hay nhiều số/số lượng; tính gộp, tính chung, tính tổng cộng:

ˌadd ˈup to sth
1 k to make a total amount of sth 
lên đến:

2 to lead to a particular result; to show sth dẫn đến một kết quả cụ thể; chỉ ra/làm sáng tỏ điều gì

after
after k /
ˈɑːftə(r); NAmE ˈæf‑
/ prep., conj., adv., adj.
_S prep.
1 k later than sth; following sth in time 
sau, sau khi:
We’ll leave after lunch. ◇ They arrived shortly after 5. ◇ Not long after that he resigned. ◇ Let’s meet the day after tomorrow/the week after next. ◇ After winning the prize she became famous overnight. ◇ After an hour I went home (= when an hour had passed). ◇ ( NAmE) It’s ten after seven in the morning (= 7.10 a.m.)
2 k … after… used to show that sth happens many times or continuously 
hết...nọ đến...kia; ...này sang...khác:
day after day of hot weather ◇ I’ve told you time after time not to do that.
asee also one after another at one
3 k behind sb when they have left; following sb 
ở đằng sau, phía sau:
Shut the door after you. ◇ I’m always having to clean up after the children (= clean the place after they have left it dirty and untidy). ◇ He ran after her with the book. ◇ She was left staring after him.
4 k next to and following sb/sth in order or importance 
đi sau; theo sau:
Your name comes after mine in the list. ◇ He’s the tallest, after Richard. ◇ After you (= Please go first). ◇ After you with the paper (= Can I have it next?).
5 k in contrast to sth  trái ngược:
It was pleasantly cool in the house after the sticky heat outside.
6 k as a result of or because of sth that has happened  do bởi, bởi vì (đã có điều gì xảy ra trước đó):
I’ll never forgive him after what he said.
7 despite sth; although sth has happened  mặc dù:
I can’t believe she’d do that, not after all I’ve done for her.
8 trying to find or catch sb/sth  truy đuổi, đuổi bắt:
The police are after him. ◇ He’s after a job at our place.
9 about sb/sth  về ai/cái gì:
She asked after you (= how you were).
10 in the style of sb/sth; following the example of sb/sth 
theo phong cách/theo gương, mẫu của ai/vật gì:
a painting after Goya ◇ We named the baby ‘Ena’ after her grandmother.
11 after- (in adjectives  thành phần kết hợp với tính từ ) happening or done later than the time or event mentioned 
sau:
after-hours drinking (= after closing time) ◇ an after-school club ◇ after-dinner mints
i
ˌafter ˈall
1 k despite what has been said or expected 
dù sao:
So you made it after all!
2 k used when you are explaining sth, or giving a reason 
rốt cuộc; xét cho cùng:
He should have paid. He suggested it, after all.
be after doing sth ( IrishE)
1 to be going to do sth soon; to be intending to do sth soon  sẽ làm sớm; dự định làm sớm
2 to have just done sth  vừa làm xong
_S conj. k at a time later than sth; when sth has finished 
sau khi:
I’ll call you after I’ve spoken to them. ◇ Several years after they’d split up they met again by chance in Paris.
_S adv. k later in time; afterwards  sau đó; về sau:
That was in 1996. Soon after, I heard that he’d died. ◇ I could come next week, or the week after. ◇ And they all lived happily ever after.
_S adj. [
only before noun ] ( old use) following; later  sau đó:
in after years

again
again k /
əˈɡen; əˈɡeɪn
/ adv.
1 k one more time; on another occasion  lại (một lần nữa); vào một dịp khác:
Could you say it again, please? ◇ When will I see you again? ◇ This must never happen again. ◇ Once again (= as had happened several times before), the train was late. ◇ I’ve told you again and again (= many times) not to do that. ◇ I’ll have to write it all over again (= again from the beginning).
2 k showing that sb/sth is in the same place or state that they were in originally 
trở về lại (nơi cũ, trạng thái cũ) :
He was glad to be home again. ◇ She spends two hours a day getting to work and back again. ◇ You’ll soon feel well again.
3 added to an amount that is already there 
thêm, thêm nữa:
The cost is about half as much again as it was two years ago. ◇ I’d like the same again (= the same amount or the same thing).
4 used to show that a comment or fact is connected with what you have just said 
ngoài ra, hơn nữa:
And again, we must think of the cost.
5 then/there ~ used to introduce a fact or an opinion that contrasts with what you have just said 
trái lại:
We might buy it but then again we might not.
6 used when you ask sb to tell you sth or repeat sth that you think they have told you already 
gì ấy nhỉ (từ để yêu cầu người khác lặp lại điều họ đã nói):
What was the name again?

against k /
əˈɡenst; əˈɡeɪnst
/ prep.
h
Xem các cách sử dụng đặc biệt của từ against trong cụm động từ tại mục từ của các động từ này. Ví dụ, count against sb ở mục cụm động từ của từ count.
1 k opposing or disagreeing with sb/sth  đối lập, chống lại ai; không đồng ý, phản đối ai:
the fight against terrorism ◇ We’re playing against the league champions next week. ◇ We were rowing against the current. ◇ That’s against the law. ◇ She was forced to marry against her will. ◇ Are you for or against the death penalty? ◇ She is against seeing (= does not want to see) him. ◇ I’d advise you against doing that.
2 k not to the advantage or favour of sb/sth  bất lợi đối với ai:
The evidence is against him. ◇ Her age is against her.
acompare for prep. ( 7)
3 close to, touching or hitting sb/sth  gần, sát với, chạm vào, tựa vào:
Put the piano there, against the wall. ◇ The rain beat against the windows.
4 in order to prevent sth from happening or to reduce the damage caused by sth 
để ngăn ngừa hoặc giảm thiệt hại do vật gì gây ra:
an injection against rabies ◇ They took precautions against fire. ◇ Are we insured against theft?
5 with sth in the background, as a contrast  (nổi bật) trên nền; trên bối cảnh: His red clothes stood out clearly against the snow. ◇ ( figurative) The love story unfolds against a background of civil war.
6 used when you are comparing two things 
so với; đối chiếu với:
You must weigh the benefits against the cost. ◇ Check your receipts against the statement. ◇ What’s the rate of exchange against the dollar?
isee as conj. ,
stacked

əˈhed

h

1 k further forward in space or time; in front 
về trước; ở phía trước:

all of sth (
often ironic) used to emphasize an amount, a size, etc. usually when it is very small  dùng để nhấn mạnh một số lượng, kích cỡ rất nhỏ:

all ˈover

all ˈround ( BrE)
( NAmE all aˈround)

ˌall ˈthere ( informal) having a healthy mind; thinking clearly  có đầu óc minh mẫn; suy nghĩ rõ ràng:

be all about sb/sth used to say what the most important aspect of sth is  quan trọng nhất là :
It’s all about money these days.
be all for sth/for doing sth ( informal) to believe strongly that sth should be done  tin chắc rằng điều gì sẽ được thực hiện:

be all ˈover sb ( informal) to show a lot of affection for or enthusiasm about sb  thể hiện nhiều tình cảm/sự quan tâm dành cho ai:

be all ˈthat ( US, informal) to be very attractive or impressive 
rất hấp dẫn/gây ấn tượng:

be all up (with sb) ( old-fashioned , informal) to be the end for sb 
đi đời:
It looks as though it’s all up with us now (= we are ruined, have no further chances, etc.).

allow k /
əˈlaʊ
/ verb
b let sb/sth do sth
1 k to let sb/sth do sth; to let sth happen or be done 
cho phép người nào/vật gì làm việc gì; cho phép/để việc gì xảy ra:
~ sb to do sth His parents won’t allow him to stay out late. ◇ He is not allowed to stay out late. ◇ They shouldn’t be allowed to get away with it. ◇ ~ sth to do sth He allowed his mind to wander. ◇ ~ yourself to do sth She won’t allow herself to be dictated to. ◇ ~ sth Smoking is not allowed in the hall.
2 k ~ sb/yourself sth to let sb have sth 
cho phép/để ai có thứ gì:

usually passive ] to let sb/sth go into, through, out of, etc. a place 
cho phép ai/vật gì đi vào, đi qua, đi ra khỏi, vv. nơi nào:
~ sth No dogs allowed (= you cannot bring them in). ◇ ~ sb/sth + adv./prep. The prisoners are allowed out of their cells for two hours a day. ◇ The crowd parted to allow her through. ◇ You won’t be allowed up (= out of bed) for several days.

alone k /
əˈləʊn; NAmE əˈloʊn
/ adj. [
not before noun
], adv.
1 k without any other people 
một mình (không có ai khác):
I don’t like going out alone at night. ◇ He lives alone. ◇ Finally the two of us were alone together. ◇ She was sitting all alone in the hall. ◇ Tom is not alone in finding Rick hard to work with.
2 k without the help of other people or things 
tự mình, một mình (không có ai hỗ trợ):
It’s hard bringing up children alone. ◇ The assassin said he had acted alone.
3 k lonely and unhappy or without any friends 
cô đơn và buồn bã/không có bạn bè:
Carol felt all alone in the world. ◇ I’ve been so alone since you went away.
4 used after a noun or pronoun to show that the person or thing mentioned is the only one  (sau danh từ, đại từ) chỉ một mình:
You can’t blame anyone else; you alone made the decision.
5 used after a noun or pronoun to emphasize one particular thing  (sau danh từ, đại từ để nhấn mạnh điều gì) chỉ một thứ:
The shoes alone cost £200.
i
go it aˈlone to do sth without help from anyone 
tự làm; tự lực:
Andrew decided to go it alone and start his own business.
leave/let sb alone k to stop annoying sb or trying to get their attention 
để ai yên:
She’s asked to be left alone but the press photographers follow her everywhere.
leave/let sth alone k to stop touching, changing, or moving sth  ngừng động chạm đến, thay đổi hoặc di chuyển vật gì:
I’ve told you before—leave my things alone!
let alone used after a statement to emphasize that because the first thing is not true or possible, the next thing cannot be true or possible either  nói gì, huống gì:
There isn’t enough room for us, let alone any guests.
stand aˈlone
1 to be independent or not connected with other people, organizations or ideas 
đứng riêng độc lập:
These islands are too small to stand alone as independent states.
2 to be not near other objects or buildings 
đứng riêng một mình:
The arch once stood alone at the entrance to the castle.
amore at time n.
along
along k /
əˈlɒŋ; NAmE əˈlɔːŋ; əˈlɑːŋ
/ prep., adv.
_S prep.
1 k from one end to or towards the other end of sth  từ đầu này sang đầu kia của một vật; dọc theo:
They walked slowly along the road. ◇ I looked along the shelves for the book I needed.
2 k in a line that follows the side of sth long 
(thành hàng) dọc theo, theo chiều dài của cái gì:
Houses had been built along both sides of the river.
3 k at a particular point on or beside sth long  tại một vị trí ở trên/bên cạnh một vật dài; nằm dọc theo:
You’ll find his office just along the corridor.
_S adv. h
Xem các cách sử dụng đặc biệt của từ along trong cụm động từ tại mục từ của các động từ này. Ví dụ, get along with sb ở mục cụm động từ của từ get.
1 k forward 
đi tới:
I was just walking along singing to myself. ◇ He pointed out various landmarks as we drove along.
2 k with sb 
đi cùng với ai:
We’re going for a swim. Why don’t you come along? ◇ I’ll be along (= I’ll join you) in a few minutes.
3 k towards a better state or position  theo hướng tốt đẹp hơn:
The book’s coming along nicely.
i
along with sb/sth k in addition to sb/sth; in the same way as sb/sth  cùng với; cũng như:
She lost her job when the factory closed, along with hundreds of others.

cùng với; cùng lúc/đồng thời với:

amount k /

/ noun, verb
_S noun [

aˈmount to sth
1 k to add up to sth; to make sth as a total 
(số lượng, khối lượng) lên đến; tổng cộng:
His earnings are said to amount to £300 000 per annum. ◇ They gave me some help in the beginning but it did not amount to much (= they did not give me much help).
2 to be equal to or the same as sth 
bằng; như:
Her answer amounted to a complete refusal. ◇ Their actions amount to a breach of contract. ◇ It’ll cost a lot—well, take a lot of time, but it amounts to the same thing.

ˌanswer ˈback to defend yourself against criticism 
tự bào chữa; biện hộ:

ˌanswer ˈback | ˌanswer sb ˈback to speak rudely to sb in authority, especially when they are criticizing you or telling you to do sth 
trả treo; cãi lại:
Don’t answer back! ◇ Stop answering your mother back!
ˈanswer for sth
1 to accept responsibility or blame for sth 
chịu/nhận trách nhiệm:
You will have to answer for your behaviour one day. ◇ This government has a lot to answer for (= is responsible for a lot of bad things).
2 to promise that sb has a particular quality or can be relied on to do sth  đảm bảo (về phẩm chất/khả năng của một người):

ˈanswer for sb (usually in negative sentences) to say that sb else will do sth or have a particular opinion  (thường dùng trong câu phủ định) trả lời thay cho ai:
I agree, but I can’t answer for my colleagues.
ˈanswer to sb (for sth) to have to explain your actions or decisions to sb 
giải trình với ai về hành động/quyết định của mình:
All sales clerks answer to the store manager.

anticipate k w
/
ænˈtɪsɪpeɪt
/ verb
1 k to expect sth 
mong chờ, trông đợi:
~ sth We don’t anticipate any major problems. ◇ Our anticipated arrival time is 8.30. ◇ The eagerly anticipated movie will be released next month. ◇ ~ doing sth They anticipate moving to bigger premises by the end of the year. ◇ ~ sth doing sth I don’t anticipate it being a problem. ◇ ~ that… We anticipate that sales will rise next year. ◇ it is anticipated that… It is anticipated that inflation will stabilize at 3%.
acompare unanticipated
2 k to see what might happen in the future and take action to prepare for it 
tiên liệu, dự đoán, lường trước và có biện pháp để đối phó:
~ sth We need someone who can anticipate and respond to changes in the fashion industry. ◇ ~ what, how, that, etc… Try and anticipate what the interviewers will ask.
3 ~ (doing) sth | ~ (sth doing) sth to think with pleasure and excitement about sth that is going to happen 
háo hức mong chờ:
We eagerly anticipated the day we would leave school. ◇ The more I anticipated arriving somewhere, the more disappointed I was.
4 ~ sb (doing sth) ( formal) to do sth before it can be done by sb else 
làm điều gì trước người khác; đi trước người khác một bước

any
any k /
ˈeni
/ det., pron., adv.
_S det.
1 k used with uncountable or plural nouns in negative sentences and questions, after if or whether, and after some verbs such as prevent, ban, forbid, etc. to refer to an amount or a number of sth, however large or small  đi với danh từ không đếm được hoặc số nhiều trong câu phủ định và câu hỏi, sau if hoặc whether và sau một số động từ như prevent, ban, forbid, vv. để chỉ một lượng/số lượng dù lớn hay nhỏ; một vài; một chút (...gì, nào):
I didn’t eat any meat. ◇ Are there any stamps? ◇ I’ve got hardly any money. ◇ You can’t go out without any shoes. ◇ He forbids any talking in class. ◇ She asked if we had any questions. h
Câu khẳng định thường dùng some thay cho any:
I’ve got some paper if you want it.
Some cũng được dùng trong câu hỏi khi người nói mong đợi câu trả lời đồng ý, tích cực: Would you like some milk in your tea?
2 k used with singular countable nouns to refer to one of a number of things or people, when it does not matter which one  (dùng với danh từ số ít đếm được) bất kỳ:
Take any book you like. ◇ Any colour will do. ◇ Any teacher will tell you that students learn at different rates.
asee also in any case at case n. ,
in any event at event ,
at any rate at rate n.
3 not just ~ sb/sth used to show that sb/sth is special  không phải bất kỳ ai/thứ gì (dùng để nhấn mạnh tính chất đặc biệt):
It isn’t just any day—it’s my birthday!
_S pron.
1 k used in negative sentences and in questions and after if or whether to refer to an amount or a number, however large or small  dùng trong câu phủ định và câu hỏi, sau if hoặc whether để chỉ một lượng/số lượng dù lớn hay nhỏ; một vài, một chút:
We need some more paint; there isn’t any left. ◇ I need some stamps. Are there any in your bag? ◇ Please let me know how many people are coming, if any. ◇ She spent hardly any of the money. ◇ He returned home without any of the others. h
Trong câu khẳng định từ some thường được dùng thay cho any. Some cũng được dùng trong câu hỏi mà người nói mong đợi câu trả lời đồng ý, tích cực: I’ve got plenty of paper—would you like some?
2 k one or more of a number of people or things, especially when it does not matter which  bất cứ ai/cái gì trong một nhóm người/vật; bất kỳ:
I’ll take any you don’t want. ◇ ‘Which colour do you want?’ ‘Any of them will do.’
i
sb isn’t having any (of it) ( informal) somebody is not interested or does not agree  (người) không quan tâm/không đồng ý:
I suggested sharing the cost, but he wasn’t having any of it.
_S adv.
1 k used to emphasize an adjective or adverb in negative sentences or questions, meaning ‘at all’  để nhấn mạnh nghĩa ‘không tí nào, chút nào’ của một tính từ/trạng từ trong câu phủ định hoặc câu hỏi:
He wasn’t any good at French. ◇ I can’t run any faster. ◇ Is your father feeling any better? ◇ I don’t want any more. ◇ If you don’t tell them, nobody will be any the wiser (= they will not find out about it).
2 ( NAmE, informal) used at the end of a negative sentence to mean ‘at all’  dùng cuối câu phủ định với nghĩa ‘không tí nào, chút nào’:
That won’t hurt you any.

adv.

any•one
anyone k /
ˈeniwʌn

( also any•body)
pron.
1 k used instead of someone in negative sentences and in questions after if/whether, and after verbs such as prevent, forbid, avoid, etc.  dùng thay someone trong câu phủ định và câu hỏi sau if/whether, và sau các động từ như prevent, forbid, avoid, vv.; người nào đó:
Is anyone there? ◇ Does anyone else want to come? ◇ Did anyone see you? ◇ Hardly anyone came. ◇ I forbid anyone to touch that clock. h
Sự khác biệt giữa anyone và someone giống sự khác biệt giữa any và some. Xem chú thích.
2 k any person at all; it does not matter who 

anything k /
ˈeniθɪŋ
/ pron.
1 k used instead of something in negative sentences and in questions; after if/whether; and after verbs such as prevent, ban, avoid, etc.  dùng thay something trong câu phủ định và câu hỏi, sau if/whether và sau các động từ như prevent, ban, avoid, vv.; cái gì (đó):
Would you like anything else? ◇ There’s never anything worth watching on TV. ◇ If you remember anything at all, please let us know. ◇ We hope to prevent anything unpleasant from happening. h

anything but definitely not 
hoàn toàn không:

anything like sb/sth k ( informal) (used in questions and negative statements) similar to sb/sth  (dùng trong câu hỏi và câu phủ định) giống ai/cái gì:

like ˈanything ( BrE, informal) very much 
rất nhiều, hết sức, vô cùng:
They’re always slagging me off like anything.
not anything like as good, much, etc. used to emphasize that sth is not as good, not enough, etc.  dùng để nhấn mạnh điều gì không tốt bằng, không bằng, vv.:
The book wasn’t anything like as good as her first one.
not for ˈanything ( informal) definitely not 
hoàn toàn không:
I wouldn’t give it up for anything.
or anything ( informal) or another thing of a similar type  hoặc thứ khác cùng loại:
If you want to call a meeting or anything, just let me know.
ˈany time any time ( BrE)
( also any•time NAmE, BrE)
adv. at a time that is not fixed 
bất kỳ lúc nào:
Call me any time. i
ˌanytime ˈsoon ( NAmE) used in negative sentences and questions to refer to the near future  (dùng trong câu phủ định và câu hỏi) sắp, sắp tới:
Will she be back anytime soon?

anyway k /
ˈeniweɪ
/
( also any•how)
(
also NAmE informal any•ways)
adv.
1 k used when adding sth to support an idea or argument 
hơn nữa, ngoài ra
s
besides
: It’s too expensive and anyway the colour doesn’t suit you. ◇ It’s too late now, anyway.
2 k despite sth; even so 
mặc dù, cho dù, tuy vậy, dù vậy:
The water was cold but I took a shower anyway. ◇ I’m afraid we can’t come, but thanks for the invitation anyway.
3 k used when changing the subject of a conversation, ending the conversation or returning to a subject  dùng để thay đổi chủ đề/kết thúc câu chuyện hoặc quay trở lại một chủ đề; thôi nhé:

4 k used to correct or slightly change what you have said  dùng để đính chính hoặc thay đổi đôi chút trong điều vừa nói:
She works in a bank. She did when I last saw her, anyway.
any•where

/

adv.

as k /
əz; strong form æz
/ prep., adv., conj.
_S prep.
1 k used to describe sb/sth appearing to be sb/sth else 
giống như, có vẻ như:
They were all dressed as clowns. ◇ The bomb was disguised as a package.
2 k used to describe the fact that sb/sth has a particular job or function 
với tư cách là:
She works as a courier. ◇ Treat me as a friend. ◇ I respect him as a doctor. ◇ You can use that glass as a vase. ◇ The news came as a shock. ◇ She had been there often as a child (= when she was a child).
_S adv.
1 k as… as… used when you are comparing two people or things, or two situations (khi so sánh)
như, bằng:
You’re as tall as your father. ◇ He was as white as a sheet. ◇ She doesn’t play as well as her sister. ◇ I haven’t known him as long as you (= as you have known him). ◇ He doesn’t earn as much as me. ◇ He doesn’t earn as much as I do. ◇ It’s not as hard as I thought. ◇ Run as fast as you can. ◇ We’d like it as soon as possible.
2 k used to say that sth happens in the same way  chỉ điều xảy ra tương tự; như, cũng như:
As always, he said little. ◇ The ‘h’ in honest is silent, as in ‘hour’.
_S conj.
1 k while sth else is happening 
trong khi:
He sat watching her as she got ready. ◇ As she grew older she gained in confidence.
alanguage bank at process
2 k in the way in which 
theo cách, như cách:
They did as I had asked. ◇ Leave the papers as they are. ◇ She lost it, just as I said she would.
3 k used to state the reason for sth 
vì, tại, do:
As you were out, I left a message. ◇ She may need some help as she’s new.
4 used to make a comment or to add information about what you have just said  dùng để đưa ra bình luận hoặc bổ sung thông tin cho điều vừa nói; như, cũng như:
As you know, Julia is leaving soon. ◇ She’s very tall, as is her mother.
5 used to say that in spite of sth being true, what follows is also true 
dù, mặc dù, cho dù
s
though
: Happy as they were, there was something missing. ◇ Try as he might (= however hard he tried), he couldn’t open the door.
i
as against sth in contrast with sth 
đối lại, ngược lại:
They got 27% of the vote as against 32% at the last election.
ˌas and ˈwhen used to say that sth may happen at some time in the future, but only when sth else has happened 
khi có dịp:
We’ll decide on the team as and when we qualify. ◇ I’ll tell you more as and when (= as soon as I can).
as for sb/sth k used to start talking about sb/sth 
về phần người nào; về mặt nào
s
regarding
: As for Jo, she’s doing fine. ◇ As for food for the party, that’s all being taken care of.
as from…/as of… used to show the time or date from which sth starts  kể từ:
Our fax number is changing as from May 12.
as if/as though k in a way that suggests sth 
như thể:
He behaved as if nothing had happened. ◇ It sounds as though you had a good time. ◇ It’s my birthday. As if you didn’t know! ◇ ‘Don’t say anything’ ‘As if I would! ’ (= surely you do not expect me to)
ˌas it ˈis considering the present situation; as things are 
theo tình hình/tình trạng hiện nay; như sự việc hiện nay:
We were hoping to finish it by next week—as it is, it may be the week after. ◇ I can’t help—I’ve got too much to do as it is (= already).
as it ˈwere used when a speaker is giving his or her own impression of a situation or expressing sth in a particular way  có thể nói như vậy:
Teachers must put the brakes on, as it were, when they notice students looking puzzled.
as to sth | as regards sth used when you are referring to sth 
đối với, về, về phần:
As to tax, that will be deducted from your salary.
as you ˈdo used as a comment on sth that you have just said  dùng để bình luận điều bạn vừa nói:
He smiled and I smiled back. As you do.
amore at well ,
yet

/ adv., noun

/

/ verb

2 to provide a person for a particular task or position 

at k /
ət; strong form æt
/ prep.
1 k used to say where sth/sb is or where sth happens 

at the corner of the street ◇ We changed at Crewe. ◇ They arrived late at the airport. ◇ At the roundabout take the third exit. ◇ I’ll be at home all morning. ◇ She’s at Tom’s (= at Tom’s house). ◇ I met her at the hospital. ◇ How many people were there at the concert?
2 k used to say where sb works or studies 
ở, tại (nơi học tập/nơi làm việc):
He’s been at the bank longer than anyone else. ◇ She’s at Yale (= Yale University).
3 k used to say when sth happens 
lúc, vào lúc:
We left at 2 o’clock. ◇ at the end of the week ◇ We woke at dawn. ◇ I didn’t know at the time of writing (= when I wrote). ◇ At night you can see the stars. ◇ ( BrE) What are you doing at the weekend?
4 k used to state the age at which sb does sth 
ở/vào độ tuổi:
She got married at 25. ◇ He left school at the age of 16.
5 k in the direction of or towards sb/sth 
về hướng, về phía; hướng đến:
What are you looking at? ◇ He pointed a gun at her. ◇ Somebody threw paint at the prime minister.
6 used after a verb to show that sb tries to do sth, or partly does sth, but does not succeed or complete it  (dùng sau động từ) để chỉ người nào cố gắng thực hiện việc gì nhưng không thành công hoặc hoàn tất:
He clutched wildly at the rope as he fell. ◇ She nibbled at a sandwich (= ate only small bits of it).
7 k used to state the distance away from sth 
ở khoảng cách/cự ly nào đó:
I held it at arm’s length. ◇ Can you read a car number plate at fifty metres?
8 k used to show the situation sb/sth is in, what sb is doing or what is happening 
đang ở trong tình trạng nào; đang làm gì; đang xảy ra việc gì:
The country is now at war. ◇ I felt at a disadvantage. ◇ I think Mr Harris is at lunch.
9 k used to show a rate, speed, etc. 
ở/với (tỷ lệ, mức/tốc độ/giá trị, vv.):
He was driving at 70 mph. ◇ The noise came at two-minute intervals (= once every two minutes). ◇ Prices start at $1 000.
10 k ~ sb’s/sth’s best/worst, etc. used to say that sb/sth is as good, bad, etc. as they can be  ở trong tình trạng tốt nhất/xấu nhất:
This was Murray at his best. ◇ The garden’s at its most beautiful in June.
11 k used with adjectives to show how well sb does sth  dùng với tính từ để chỉ mức độ tốt xấu khi làm việc gì, lĩnh vực nào:
I’m good at French. ◇ She’s hopeless at managing people.
12 k used with adjectives to show the cause of sth  (đi với tính từ) do bởi, bởi vì:
They were impatient at the delay. ◇ She was delighted at the result.
13 ( formal) in response to sth 
để đáp lại:
They attended the dinner at the chairman’s invitation.
14 k ( NAmE) used when giving a telephone number 

You can reach me at 637-2335, extension 354.

ngưỡng mộ và có phần e sợ người nào/vật gì; kính sợ:
While Diana was in awe of her grandfather, she adored her grandmother.

usually passive

awe 

ˈawe-inspir•ing awe-inspiring adj. impressive; making you feel respect and admiration 
gây ấn tượng; gây kính sợ:
The building was awe-inspiring in size and design.
awe•some awesome /
ˈɔːsəm
/ adj.
1 very impressive or very difficult and perhaps rather frightening  rất gây ấn tượng/khó khăn và có thể hơi đáng sợ:

2 ( especially NAmE, informal) very good, enjoyable, etc 
tuyệt vời, rất thú vị:
I just bought this awesome new CD! ◇ Wow! That’s totally awesome!

That’s an awful colour. ◇ ‘They didn’t even offer to pay.’ ‘Oh that’s awful.’ ◇ It’s awful, isn’t it? ◇ The weather last summer was awful. ◇ I feel awful about forgetting her birthday. ◇ to look/feel awful (= to look/feel ill) ◇ There’s an awful smell in here. ◇ The awful thing is, it was my fault.
anote at terrible
2 k ( informal) used to emphasize sth, especially that there is a large amount or too much of sth  (nhiều) quá mức; thừa mứa:
It’s going to cost an awful lot of money. ◇ There’s not an awful lot of room. ◇ I feel an awful lot better than I did yesterday. ◇ ( BrE) I had an awful job persuading him to come (= it was very difficult).

ax)

] ( informal) (often used in newspapers  thường dùng trên báo chí ) if sb gets the axe, they lose their job; if an institution or a project gets the axe, it is closed or stopped, usually because of a lack of money 
sự mất việc; sự đóng cửa/phá sản (thường vì thiếu tiền):
Up to 300 workers are facing the axe at a struggling Merseyside firm. ◇ Patients are delighted their local hospital has been saved from the axe.

ˌhave an ˈaxe to grind to have private reasons for being involved in sth or for arguing for a particular cause 
có lý do riêng để tham gia/tranh luận vì mục đích nào đó:
She had no axe to grind and was only acting out of concern for their safety.
_S verb ( BrE)
( US ax)
[
often passive
]
1 ~ sth ( informal) (often used in newspapers  thường dùng trên báo chí ) to get rid of a service, system, etc. or to reduce the money spent on it by a large amount 
bỏ (dịch vụ, hệ thống,...); giảm mạnh (tiền chi tiêu):
Other less profitable services are to be axed later this year.
2 ~ sb ( informal) (often used in newspapers  thường dùng trên báo chí ) to remove sb from their job 
sa thải:
Jones has been axed from the team.
